src:
Začetek nove dobe mobilnosti pri Volkswagnu
07 Nov 2019, 06:00 by Peter Pirkovič

V ponedeljek so v nemškem Zwickau slovesno zagnali serijsko proizvodnjo električnega ID.3. To je prvo vozilo, ki pri nemškem proizvajalcu napoveduje nove priložnosti in hkrati napoveduje še vsaj pet novih električnih vozil iz omenjenega koncerna.



Pri Volkswagnu napovedujejo, da bo novi ID.3 kupcem, tudi v Sloveniji, na voljo sredi leta 2020.  Foto: Volkswagen

Slovesnost je s prihodom in nagovorom počastila tudi nemška kanclerka Angela Merkel, ki je med drugim pohvalila preobrazbo avtomobilskega velikana in hkrati napovedala, da se bo Nemčija precej razvijala na področju električnih vozil. Namreč, do leta 2030 naj bi bilo v Nemčiji postavljenih več kot milijon električnih polnilnic, kar naj bi spodbudilo nakup električnih vozil v prihodnosti. Tako kot nekateri drugi, tudi Volkswagen zdaj resno računa uveljavitev v segmentu električno gnanih vozil. Za njihov prvi pravi električni avto z oznako ID.3, ki je primerljiv z golfom, se je ogrelo že več kot 35.000 kupcev po vsej Evropi. Nekaj sto jih je predujem vplačalo tudi v Sloveniji, prvi pa se bodo z njim vozili predvidoma poleti 2020.
Letno do 330.000 električarjev
Da je Volkswagnov načrt z električnimi vozili precej ambiciozen, dokazuje tudi dejstvo, da bo prenovljena tovarna specializirana zgolj za proizvodnjo električnih vozil in to na način, da bodo do konca prihodnjega leta dosegli letno proizvodnjo 220.000 vozil, ob koncu leta 2021 pa se bo ta številka gibala okrog 330.000. V omenjeno tovarno na Saškem, katere preobrazba je trajala dve leti, so pri Volkswagnu vložili 1,2 milijarde evrov in za delo usposobili približno 8000 delavcev, v njej pa se bo rojevalo šest modelov različnih koncernskih znamk, izdelanih na MEB platformi. Obenem gre za obrat, ki je trenutno eden izmed bolj sodobnih na svetu in kjer je za večino delovnih procesov podlaga digitalizacija.
Navkljub velikemu številu zaposlenih je na proizvodnih trakovih še vedno 1700 robotov, medtem ko je transport sestavnih delov do določenih postaj urejen povsem avtonomno. V tovarno sestavni deli za električna vozila prihajajo iz Volkswagnovih tovarn v Brunswicku, Kasslu, Salzgitterju in Wolfsburgu. Strategija, ki jo ponuja trenutna uprava nemškega proizvajalca kaže na dejstvo, da nameravajo do leta 2028 globalno prodati 22 milijonov električnih vozil, od tega jih bo polovico prispeval kitajski trg.
ID.3 bo stal dobrih 22 tisočakov
Posebnost modela ID.3 bo v dosegu in ceni. Petvratna kombilimuzina ima predviden doseg približno 550 kilometrov, kar bo sicer odvisno tudi od izbrane baterije. Visokonapetostna baterija se nahaja v dnu avtomobila, pomožne enote, na primer kompresor klimatske naprave, pa so spredaj. Baterija skupaj z elektromotorjem, ki poganja zadnjo os, tvori zelo kompaktno enoto, tu je vključen tudi enostopenjski menjalnik.
Zaradi pametne razporeditve je sprednji del lahko tudi zelo aerodinamično učinkovit, koeficient upora znaša le 0,27, medtem ko je masa vendarle višja, avto tehta 1719 kilogramov. Kupcem bodo na voljo tri zmogljivosti baterije - osnovni model ima 45 kWh za 330 kilometrov dosega, srednji 58 kWh za 420 kilometrov in najvišji 77 kWh za 550 kilometrov. 100-kilovatni polnilnik bo v idealnih pogojih avto za 290 kilometrov napolnil le v 30 minutah. Redna cena osnovnega modela bo pod 30 tisočaki in če od te odštejemo še trenutnih 7500 evrov subvencije, je končna cena razmeroma ugodna.


Slovesnosti v Zwickau se je udeležila tudi nemška kanclerka Angela Merkel, kar je pomenilo posebno čast za Volkswagen. Foto: Volkswagen
text:
The beginning of a new era of mobility at Volkswagen
07 Nov 2019, 06:00 by Peter Pirkovic

On Monday, the serial production of electric ID.3 was solemnly launched in Zwickau, Germany. This is the first vehicle that announces new opportunities at the German manufacturer and at the same time announces at least five new electric vehicles from the mentioned group.



Volkswagen announces that new ID.3 will be available to buyers, including in Slovenia, in mid-2020. Photo: Volkswagen

The ceremony was also welcomed by German Chancellor Angela Merkel, who praised, among other things, the transformation of the car giant and at the same time announced that Germany would develop a lot in the field of electric vehicles. Namely, by the year 2030, more than one million electric chargers will be installed in Germany, which should encourage the purchase of electric vehicles in the future. Like some others, Volkswagen is now seriously considering establishing itself in the electrically driven vehicle segment. For their first true golf-comparable ID.3 electric car, more than 35,000 customers across Europe have warmed up. A few hundred have also been paid in advance in Slovenia, with the first expected to be rolled out in the summer of 2020.
Up to 330,000 electricians annually
Volkswagen's plan for electric vehicles is quite ambitious, as evidenced by the fact that the refurbished factory will only specialize in the production of electric vehicles in a way that will reach an annual production of 220,000 vehicles, and by the end of 2021 this figure will be ranged about 330,000. The plant in Saxony, which has been transformed for two years, has invested 1.2 billion euros in Volkswagen and trained about 8,000 workers, and will produce six models of various brands made on the MEB platform. At the same time, it is a plant that is currently one of the more modern in the world and where digitalization is the basis for most work processes.
Despite the large number of employees, there are still 1,700 robots on the production lines, while the transport of components to certain stations is completely autonomous. The factory components for electric vehicles come from Volkswagen's factories in Brunswick, Kassel, Salzgitter and Wolfsburg. The strategy offered by the current German manufacturer's management points to the fact that they plan to sell 22 million electric vehicles globally by 2028, half of which will be contributed by the Chinese market.
ID.3 will cost a good 22 thousand
The peculiarity of the ID.3 will be in its reach and price. The five-door limo has an estimated range of approximately 550 kilometers, which will also depend on the battery selected. A high-voltage battery is located in the bottom of the car, and auxiliary units, such as an air conditioner compressor, are in the front. The battery, together with the electric motor that drives the rear axle, forms a very compact unit and includes a single-stage gearbox.
Due to its clever layout, the front can also be very aerodynamically efficient, with a drag coefficient of only 0.27, while the mass is still higher, the car weighs 1719 pounds. Customers will have three battery options available - the base model has 45 kWh for 330 miles of reach, a mid-range 58 kWh for 420 kilometers and a top 77 kWh for 550 kilometers. The 100-kilowatt charger will ideally charge a 290-mile car in 30 minutes. The regular price of the basic model will be below $ 30,000, and subtracting the current $ 7,500 subsidy, the final price is relatively favorable.


German Chancellor Angela Merkel also attended the ceremony in Zwicka, a special honor for Volkswagen. Photo: Volkswagen
